content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/spring-boot-helloWorld is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
The user wants me to migrate a Java project from JDK 8 to JDK 17. I need to:
1. First explore the repository structure to understand what we're working with
2. Check the current Java version configuration (pom.xml or build.gradle)
3. Update the configuration to use Java 17
4. Check for any code that might need updates for Java 17 compatibility
5. Run `mvn clean verify` to ensure everything works
6. Fix any issues that arise

Let me start by exploring the repository structure.

content.text: I'll help you migrate this Java 8 project to Java 17. Let's start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with.

Now let's look at the pom.xml file to see the current Java version configuration:

File content displayed in console.
Content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
	xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
	<modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

	<groupId>com.neo</groupId>
	<artifactId>spring-boot-helloworld</artifactId>
	<version>0.9.6-SNAPSHOT</version>
	<packaging>jar</packaging>

	<name>spring-boot-helloworld</name>
	<description>Demo project for Spring Boot</description>

	<parent>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>2.1.3.RELEASE</version>
		<relativePath/> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>

	<properties>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
		<java.version>1.8</java.version>
	</properties>

	<dependencies>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
			<scope>test</scope>
		</dependency>
	     <dependency>
	        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
	        <artifactId>spring-boot-devtools</artifactId>
	        <optional>true</optional>
		</dependency>
	</dependencies>
	
	<build>
		<plugins>
			<plugin>
				<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
				<artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
				<configuration>
	                <fork>true</fork>
	            </configuration>
			</plugin>
		</plugins>
	</build>

        <repositories>
            <repository>
                <id>aliyun-repos</id>
                <url>https://maven.aliyun.com/repository/public</url>
                <releases>
                    <enabled>true</enabled>
                </releases>
                <snapshots>
                    <enabled>false</enabled>
                </snapshots>
            </repository>
        </repositories>
        <pluginRepositories>
            <pluginRepository>
                <id>aliyun-repos</id>
                <url>https://maven.aliyun.com/repository/public</url>
                <releases>
                    <enabled>true</enabled>
                </releases>
                <snapshots>
                    <enabled>false</enabled>
                </snapshots>
            </pluginRepository>
        </pluginRepositories>

</project>
Now let's check the Java source files to see if there's any Java 8 specific code:
Let's also check the test files:

Now I'll migrate the project from Java 8 to Java 17. The main changes needed are:

1. Update the Java version in pom.xml from 1.8 to 17
2. Update Spring Boot version from 2.1.3.RELEASE to a version that supports Java 17 (at least 2.5.x, but 2.7.x is better)
3. Update JUnit tests from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5 (Jupiter), as this is recommended for Java 17

Let's start with updating the pom.xml:

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.
File: /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/spring-boot-helloWorld/pom.xml
Replaced 1 occurrence
Old string: 	<parent>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>2.1.3.RELEASE</version>
		<relativePath/> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>

	<properties>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
		<java.version>1.8</java.version>
	</properties>
New string: 	<parent>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>2.7.18</version>
		<relativePath/> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>

	<properties>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
		<java.version>17</java.version>
	</properties>
Now let's update the test files to use JUnit 5 (Jupiter) instead of JUnit 4. Let's start with ApplicationTests.java:
Now let's update HelloWorldControlerTests.java:
Now let's update HelloTests.java:
Now let's clean and verify the project with Maven. First, let's check the Java version:

Perfect! Java 17 is available. Now let's clean the project and run the build:

Perfect! The migration from Java 8 to Java 17 has been completed successfully. Here's a summary of the changes made:

## Migration Changes:

### 1. **pom.xml**
   - Updated Java version from `1.8` to `17`
   - Updated Spring Boot version from `2.1.3.RELEASE` to `2.7.18` (to ensure full Java 17 compatibility)

### 2. **Test Files - Migrated from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5**
   - **ApplicationTests.java**: Changed imports from `org.junit.Test` to `org.junit.jupiter.api.Test` and removed `@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)`
   - **HelloWorldControlerTests.java**: Changed `@Before` to `@BeforeEach`, updated imports to JUnit 5
